item.title: Brian add a quote by Richard Dawkins
item.description: "We are all atheists about most of the gods that humanity has ever believed in. Some of us just go one god further." -- Richard Dawkins

item.title: Brian add a quote by Richard Dawkins
item.description: "You could give Aristotle a tutorial. And you could thrill him to the core of his being ... Such is the privilege of living after Newton, Darwin, Einstein, Planck, Watson, Crick and their colleagues." -- Richard Dawkins

item.title: Brian add a quote by Richard Dawkins
item.description: "...when two opposite points of view are expressed with equal intensity, the truth does not necessarily lie exactly halfway between them. It is possible for one side to be simply wrong." -- Richard Dawkins

item.title: Brian add a quote by Carl Sagan
item.description: "For me, it is far better to grasp the Universe as it really is than to persist in delusion, however satisfying and reassuring." -- Carl Sagan

item.title: Brian add a quote by Carl Sagan
item.description: "Science is not only compatible with spirituality; it is a profound source of spirituality." -- Carl Sagan

item.title: Brian add a quote by Carl Sagan
item.description: "Somewhere, something incredible is waiting to be known." -- Carl Sagan

item.title: Brian add a quote by Dan Barker
item.description: "Scientists do not join hands every Sunday and sing "Yes gravity is real! I know gravity is real! I will have faith! I believe in my heart that what goes up, up, up must come down, down, down. Amen!" If they did, we would think they were pretty insecure about the concept." -- Dan Barker
